instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1706 820-00239 5/20v
threads.message:
Hi,
I have an A1706 820-00239-A with no power.
I once fixed the PM_BATLOW_L lines.
UB300 and UB400
with battery:
-restarts the ammeter on all USB
-Now on 2 usb ports (UB300 and UB400) I have 20v. Present PP1V1_UPC.
-On 3100 and 3200 I have 5v. PP1V1_UPC is missing on both.
Without batteries, there is 5v everywhere
- restarts the ammeter on all USB
-  PP1V1_UPC have 0.53 in Diode-Mode

threads.title: A1706 820-00239 5/20v
threads.message:
There must be a problem on U3100/200 area.
Bad component, or U2890 corrupted.

threads.title: A1706 820-00239 5/20v
threads.message:
sorry correction 
UB300 and UB400
with battery:
-Now on 2 usb ports (UB300 and UB400) I have 20v but restarts the ammeter . 
-On 3100 and 3200 I have 0v. 
Without batteries, there is 5v everywhere
- UB300 and UB400 Present PP1V1_UPC  but restarts the ammeter. 
- U3100 and U3200 no PP1V1_UPC and no restarts 
-  PP1V1_UPC have 0.53 in Diode-Mode

threads.title: A1706 820-00239 5/20v
threads.message:
"On 3100 and 3200 I have 0v"
Do you mean 0V on USB-C meter?
It shows 0V, no black screen?

Compare diode mode readings between J3300 and JB500.

threads.title: A1706 820-00239 5/20v
threads.message: I mean 00.00 on the display -  I use by-3200. When I connect battery appears 5v.

threads.title: A1706 820-00239 5/20v
threads.message:
Don't you have the classic USB-C meter?
I don't understand what the people see on that blue bulshit.

threads.title: A1706 820-00239 5/20v
threads.message: I replaced 2x CD3215s and I have 20v. Does this board boot without batteries ?
